itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Friday, May 31, 2013
teaser: In February, then March, Americans spent more money than the month before. But today there's news that consumer spending dropped a tenth percent in April.
title: We're spending less on things that are getting cheaper
description: In February, then March, Americans spent more money than the month before. But today there's news that consumer spending dropped a tenth percent in April.
contentencoded:
In February, then March, Americans spent more money than the month before. But today there's news that consumer spending dropped a tenth percent in April. It's being read by some as a sign of a tepid economy.

Chris Low, chief economist with FTN Financial, joins Marketplace Morning Report host David Brancaccio to share his take.
